commit_message: Edited code to generate the final plots.
Applied script to the new outer polarisation data. Some other changes.
Generated new figures for the new outer parsimony polarised data, as well as figures corrected by INTR.
Minor changes.
Added sections for the new ancestral inferences: one with root parsimony, and the other with outgroup parsimony.
Huge commit (should've performed several minor commits before).
Huge commit (should've performed several minor commits before).
Added section C (Eurasian lynx phylogeography project).

Added the following sections:
· Check density of CDS mutations along genes.
· Check behaviour of derived alleles after discarding sites from high mutation genes.
Minor changes.
Moved section that counts derived alleles in variants with no warnings to the new LoF script.
Added section to count (and plot) derived alleles in variants with no annotation warnings.
Initial commit. Added code to check the density of LoF variants per gene.

Added code to infer tiger-cat-rufus ancestral state by parsimony. Added code to get counts for all syntenic sites, those with consistent polarisation between methods, and those with inconsistent sites.
Added AFS for sites with consistent polarisation after applying 3-species parsimony. Added variant counts and plots for sites with no SnpEff warnings.
Test commit. ÑAÑAÑA!
Initial commit. Retrieved tiger-cat-Iberian lynx synteny only for the variants in my study.
Rproj.
Initial commit. Based on Maria's code.
Created new sections: one for Iberian reference nm2nm3 (original), another for Iberian reference nm3, and another for Canada reference. Adapted code within each of the two new sections.
Added missense tolerated and deleterious categories to the derived allele counts script.
Added entire sections: telomere (2 and 10MB), centromere, and Xchr blocks definition and bootstrap. Modified figure code to obtain the final (manuscript) versions.
Minor changes.

Added pretty version of multiple figures. Made alternate MAF spectra. Added new origcov vs. samecov figures. Added Xchr regions. Added derived homozygous counts and proportion. Generated deleterious variants database.
Added telomeres section.
Fixed random seed generation in the multi-run ngsF-HMM section. Recoded individuals as a factor for the plots, and other minor changes.
Added section to run ngsF-HMM.sh. Edited format of the figures. Other minor changes.
Added section that excludes transitions from the genotype likelihood calculus (and all subsequent steps). Adapted the figures to María's format.
Added an entire section for the ancient Eurasian lynx project, and adapted the whole code.
Added per block counts for a new variable, the derived allele homozygous counts.
Changed telomere and centromere plots to depict only 5x individuals.
Changed plots to depict 5x individuals only.
Initial commit: script to test the difference between nonsense mutations using the Iberian lynx or the Canada lynx reference genomes.
Minor changes.

Added lots of changes:
· Derived allele heterozygous scripts.
· Section to draw the coordinates for each bootstrapped genome.
· Section to perform bootstrap at the population level: for derived allele counts, for derived allele counts for the 5x samples only, for heterozygous alleles, and for heterozygous alleles relative to Kirov.
· Section to perform bootstrap at the species level: for derived allele counts, for derived allele counts for the 5x samples only, and for heterozygous alleles.
· Section to download the bootstrap files.
· Section to plot results at the population and the species level.

Included all previous code under the "Iberian lynx reference" section. Added new "Canada lynx reference" section which includes all populations in the new phylogeography project (Caucasus and Balkans), and performed all those analyses.
Added per dataset split. Added per population split without accounting for the dataset.

Initial commit. Added the following sections: block definition, parallelisation parameters, derived allele counts, server uploading, per-block runs, bootstrapping of block-statistics, error calculus, server downloading, results plotting.
Added 'stop-gained' category.
Minor changes.
Repeated Rxy ratio and jackknife relative to introns. Added variant counts and plots for GC-categories. Added calculus of πN and πS per site.
Added section to split VCFs in GC-categories.

Added curation of NCBI annotation. Added UCSC annotation. Built the SnpEff library for both. Run the code for both. Completed the following sections: variant filtering, division per dataset, depth range calculus and filtering, division per population, division per individual, counts retrieval (including gBGC), and plot section.
Initial commit. Copied the genetic_load_nm3_parallel_calling.Rmd script and fixed paths.
Minor changes.
Changed definitive version of genetic load, fixed load and heterozygosity per site figures. Added raw homozygous counts (no DP filter) for all categories and subcategories. Added raw homozygous plot.

Added section for the definitive figures (relativised to Kirov but nothing else). Added 5x-only version of the heterozygosis figure, and another one for the final version. Added definitive version of the RDA figure that relativises SYN & NSYN subcategories to the category's total.
Reordered sections. Added final section where all chunks are combined back into a single file, and sample names are fixed.
Minor changes: fixed $CALLING definition inside screen and script in several sections, fixed some paths.
Added analysis for the nonsense category.
Added plots of load relative to introns.
Minor changes.
Added the whole Gowinda analysis section based on María's code and the Gowinda wiki website. Added Gowinda runs at the population level (all categories together).
Initial commit. Copied the GATK_parallel_tests script and adapted it to the nm3 calling. Modified the region chunks code to a less flexible but more accurate code.
Added section to generate a fasta file with the protein sequence for the subset of genes that have missense mutations. This is obsolete, as I created another database that includes all genes.

Changed old database name to "reactome". Added new database "orthologous". Combined both to obtain the updated version. Updated variant count script with all the latest changes including UCNE and SYN breakdown.
Removed test section with variant counts for the SYN breakdown categories.
Added NM<=3 filtering for Lynx pardinus samples.

Updated variant counting scripts with latest changes for IBD, centromere and telomere. Added intermediate files to variant counting scripts to optimise them. Added SYN breakdown to plots. Added 5x-only version for some load and heterozygosis plots. Added new load IBD, centromere and telomere plots (relative to introns). Updated total sites counts with SYN breakdowns.
Added a new dataset: all genes except for the high expression ones, to better contrast them.

Added section to build the codon usage for genes with SYN mutations. Added a species variable to adapt the code to the different reference genomes. Added section to break SYN mutations down into preferred and unpreferred categories based on the optimal codons from the all_genes_database script.
Added section for the private_segregating category.

Initial commit. Added code to obtain sequences from all CDS from all genes. Added calculus of codon usage section, including proportion and chi^2 tests. Added same sections for different gene subsets: ribosomal (abandoned), housekeeping confidence, GETx high expression, low ENC. Created clean conversion of human-lynx orthologous genes that was used elsewhere in the script. Created a different section to analyse the codon usage and manually retrieve the optimal codons. Also another for CodonW analysis.
Added private category to the variant counts script. Added synonymous category breakdown. Optimised speed of script by making intermediate files. Updated derived counts relative to introns.
Deleted obsolete sections (GERP scores based on LiftOver) and added a clearer structure to the script.

Added the following:
· Several sanity checks to the human-lynx coordinates equivalence script.
· Retrieve GERP scores from human coordinates.
· Convert those back to bed (including further sanity checks).
· Convert to lynx coordinates (including further sanity checks).
· Subset to lynx derived positions only.
· GERP score distribution analysis and plots.

Added section to define segregating and fixed positions for each species (the former have 0<AF<1 and the latter have AF=1). These are different from the previously defined variants and substitutions. Added code to split these species-level data to dataset level. From there on, the previous code (pop and individual level) applies.
Added UCNE breakdown categories to the individual variant count and visualisation scripts. Split visualisation among three plots. Added population-level variant counts.
Minor changes.
Initial commit. Added script to retrieve and count fixed and private segregating derived alleles for each species, which are needed to perform the MK positive selection test.

Initial commit (actually this was done months ago!!!). Includes:
· Prepared Lyca repetitive regions.
· Performed variant calling both with and without repetitive regions.
· Prepared annotation file.
· Prepared ancestral genome (rufus) based on Lyca.
· Polarised vcf.
· Set up Lyca SnpEff database.
· Annotated vcf.

Initial commit. Added the following:
· Calculated codon usage within lynx.
· Obtained wildtype and mutated synonymous codons.

Initial commit. Added sections:
· To study per individual variation within UCNE.
· To study distribution of UCNE variants.
· To obtain human-lynx coordinate equivalence using BLAST in order to retrieve GERP scores.
· Obsolete version of the human-lynx coordinate equivalence based on LiftOver.
Fixed per category denominator estimates (accounting for repetitive and low mappability regions).
Minor plot code changes.

Added BAM quality checks section: insert size distribution, coverage, fastQ stats, BAM stats, summary report.
Added edit distance section, including plots.
Minor changes.

Added several things:
· new derived allele frequency ratio plots
· new derived allele counts ratio plots, including population average ± standard error plots
· new individual heterozygous and homozygous plots
· new diversity scripts to plot average nucleotide individual heterozygosity and average nucleotide derived allele ratio (using both pre-filter and post-filter estimates of the denominator)
· added new estimates of size of categories within CDS based on bibliography
· added section to obtain HWE statistics
· added section to estimate Watterson's theta
Added new estimate of the total sites post-filter for each category.
Minor changes.

Added several processing steps: adding read groups, merging bams, removing duplicates, performing realignment. Added the entire MACROGEN project. Added section to retrieve the distribution of NM distance.
Minor changes.
Added new plots that represent the population average number of derived alleles, and the standard error.
Minor changes.

Initial commit. I adapt code from Maria's mapping script to obtain sorted bams mapped to the Lynx canadensis reference genome for four different projects: LYNX_06_08, LYNX_09, LYNX_PROJECT, and the Iberian Lynx REFERENCE_GENOME.
Added a general filter 6 (low depth). Processed everything again from that point on. Now the per-dataset depth filter includes only high depth.
Minor changes.
Minor changes.
Added fast variant counts for different versions of the filtered VCFs (no depth filtering, variations on the depth filtering, no missingness filtering...).
Changed maxDepth and minDepth definitions for the depth filter. Added subsections to obtain variant counts after changing or skipping the depth filtering, or after skipping the missingness filtering.
Added sections to subset deleterious genes, get variant counts and plot those.
Minor changes.
Added section to generate plots with counts relativised to intergenic and synonymous.
Added section to relativise counts by a neutral category and then by Kirov's ratio. Added plots for these.
Added counts for other categories, added section to combine counts in a single file, and added R code to plot results.
Created script that counts per individual variants directly from the joint VCFs using BCFtools.
Minor changes.
Added section that estimates the proportion of filtered whole-genome positions based on the number of filtered variants.
Generated section to obtain VCF files with IBD coordinates according to the old definition (based on BAMs that weren't filtered for NM).

· Generated section to count variants with IBD coordinates according to the old definition (based on BAMs that weren't filtered for NM).
· Added section that calculates PI and heterozygosity vs NS/S for the joint calling.
· Fixed code of some figures and paths, and other minor changes.
Generated section to obtain BED files with IBD coordinates according to the old definition (based on BAMs that weren't filtered for NM).
Initial commit. Prepared RVIS database and performed some exploratory analysis.

Ammending previous commit, which had the wrong description:
· Added joint calling version for many analyses.
· Added NSYN & NTOL categories for many analyses.
· Added section to perform the derived allele frequency ratio direct jackknife (no pseudovalues).
· Added variant counts for the IBD files and others.
· Other minor changes.
Added sites counts for the joint calling.
Added section to obtain for each type of variant a filtered version of the main vcf.
Added code to launch two parallel runs of provean. Added section to split deleterious from tolerated variants.

Modified the translation code to change the agent for every iteration, and to report progress. Added temporary code to translate partial genes. Modified the provean code to report progress. Added section to select variants marked as deleterious.

Removed the unused approach ("Adapt coordinates to exon"). Added code to retrieve the aminoacid changes of missense variants, adapt them to mono-letter format and generate one file per gene. Added code to fix protein sequences retrieved from expasy. Added code to run Provean and store results in a single file.
Plotted distribution of ROHs and number of long ROHs.

Prettified code of the "adapt coordinates to exons" approach. Aborted. Started new "fuse exons" approach where I obtained a list of genes with missense variants, extracted coordinates of their CDSs, retrieved their sequences from the rufus fasta, fused them gene by gene, and translated them to proteins.
Initial commit. Added brute code to obtain for any variant the CDS sequence containing it (first the coordinates in bed format, then the sequence in fasta), and to translate it to protein.

Rearranged sections. Added section to check the installation of SIFT algorithm. Added section to download the protein database. Added section to prepare the annotation and the fasta files. Added section to prepare the config file. Added section to test the installation of SIFT database. Added section to build the Iberian lynx database, but it fails due to missing start_codon and stop_codon annotations.
Minor changes.
Added separate section for the joint calling. Fixed paths and sections.
Added code to generate the length distribution of per individual IBD tracts.

Added hard-filters testing for the c_ll_lp_plus_h_ll calling that was used for phylogeography. The lack of RankSum annotations for many variants (substitutions, no mixed reads due to subsampled coverage) implies that they will be lost due to GATK's erroneous filtering.
Added $VAR variable to the script that counts sites from the joint calling.
Minor changes.

Added hard-filters tests. Many variants without RankSum annotations (no alternative reads due to substitutions or low coverage) are being lost during the GATK hard-filters. Thus, it's better to use the joint calling, or to apply the hard-filters with bcftools.

Initial commit. Final pipeline to process variants and substitutions from the joint calling. Adapted the code from the variants_final_pipeline and the substitutions_final_pipeline scripts. Created new variable VAR that can be set to "variants", "substitutions" or "varssubs" (i.e. both).
Launched a run with K=1000 and fixed paths.

Added code to obtain counts from less filtered VCFs.
Added section with diversity approaches that contains code to obtain heterozygous counts, per category PI calculus, heterozygosity reduction (HR) estimates, and various plots.
Minor changes.
Added code to obtain substitutions from a less filtered VCF.
Added code to obtain per individual VCFs from a less filtered VCF.
Added block size tests and corrected some paths.
Initial commit. Installing the SIFT algorithm (incompatible with mac) and the SIFT database builder (successful). Converted .gff3 file to .gtf. Prepared Lynx pardinus config file.

Added some exploratory analyses: counted and plotted variants+substitutions before applying coverage filters to check if the latter affect the former (doesn't seem to). Also rescued derived positions that were AF=0 (before polarisation) within one species and SNPs in the other. They are few.

Added transversions only analysis, including counts and figures. Added global derived allele frequency ratios (variants + substitutions) for the joint calling (lp + ll), as well as derived allele counts.
Amending previous (erroneous) commit. Added section that extracts transversions only (damage-proof) for the callings that involve old samples. Added VEP tests.

Initial commit. Adapted whole code to the all-sites calling. Key changes occured in the filtering section, where everything had to be written for bcf-tools. Samples were renamed after the filtering. Then sites were tallied for each species, and the proportion of sites that would be removed with the subsequent depth filter were estimated based on the variant-only depth filters.
Created section that generates VCFs for each IBD category. Generated section that calculates average diversity statistics (not considering invariant sites).
Created section that generates VCFs for each IBD category. Adapted some other sections to understand the $TYPE variable.

Multiple changes:
· Modified derived allele frequency ratio jackknife code to adapt to Aylwyn Scally's explanation.
· Perfected derived allele frequency ratio figures.
· Added section to study the distribution of the numerator of the derived allele frequency ratio, but it doesn't make sense to study this.
· Added plots with derived allele counts and ratios for the final dataset.
· Added NS/S ratio plots for the final dataset.
· Added code to obtain individual annotation statistics for IBD tracts / notIBD tracts.
· Added plots of individual variant counts for IBD tracts / notIBD tracts.
· Restructured sections.
Added section that splits IBD tracts coordinates, generating a .bed file of IBD tracts for each individual.
Minor changes.
Added TYPE variable to the section that obtains the per population VCFs.
Added another jackknife alternative that allows for resampling. Added a plot for derived frequency ratio that includes the error bars.
Added code to cross VCF data with diversity data (which María obtained using ANGSD). Since the first code was too slow, I programmed a more efficient alternative.
Finished jackknife code and added a variant of variance estimates that yields the same results.
Working on jackknife of derived allele frequency ratios.
Further adapted remaining sections of derived allele frequency ratio to account for various types of variants.
Moved individual and population variant and allele counts sections to the genetic_load_statistics script.

Lots of changes:
· Adapted derived allele frequency ratio to account for various types of variants.
· Added code to plot the derived allele frequency ratio.
· Moved individual and population variant and allele counts and plots sections from the genetic_load_variants_final_pipeline (and substitutions) scripts.
· Added homozygous variant counts and plots sections.
Adapted the whole section 3 and generated code for some plots.
Adapted GATK code to all-sites calling, but HaplotypeCaller isn't compatible with this so these changes make no sense.
Adapted code to real w-g file, wrote a flexible scaffolds partition system, and moved everything to /GRUPOS.
Update and rename derived_allele_freq_ratio.Rmd to genetic_load_statistics.Rmd
Added variant counts comparison plots.

Added INDEL filtering within section 8, and then adapted subsequent sections to take the type of variant into account (SNP vs INDEL), but not all of them since we realised INDELs haven't been properly polarised.
Unified SNP and INDEL selection and filtering inside a common section with more universal code. When computing annotation statistics, added allele counts for certain categories.
Added INDEL filtering within section 8, and then adapted subsequent sections to take the type of variant into account (SNP vs INDEL).
Added annotation statistics at the (subsampled) population level.
Added annotation statistics at the (subsampled) population level.
Added introns to the study features. Added code to obtain and plot allele frequency spectra.
Added "Generate data to subsample populations" and "Subsample populations" sections.
Added "Generate data to subsample populations" and "Subsample populations" sections.
Minor changes
Minor changes.
Removed derived allele frequency ratio section.
Removed derived allele frequency ratio section.
Initial commit. Moved the derived allele fequency ratio sections from the vars and subs scripts. Added a section with global ratios.
Added derived allele frequency ratio calculus. Slight modifications from the variants pipeline to account for divisions by 0.
Minor changes.
Minor changes.
Minor changes.
Added printable messages to inform of the progress of the processes, including an error scenario if $PARALLEL is invalid.
Added 'exit' command to terminate the screens after the scripts are complete.
Added section with derived allele frequency ratio calculus.
Path and minor changes.
Created script that tests speed of parallel vs. at-once callings.
Removed separate calling (i.e. not substitutions) from the script. Added filters to keep substitutions only. Minor changes across the script.
Removed joint callings (i.e. for substitutions) from the script. Redefined $SPECIES and $DATASETS variables better. Added plots for h_ll_pv. Added derived allele frequency ratio calculus.
Added code that Maria, Enrico & I wrote together to plot the length of the IBD tracts defined by ngsF-HMM. Edited code to obtain bamlists for beagle.
Duplicated genetic_load_variants_final_pipeline.Rmd to serve as the basis for the substitutions pipeline.

Update and rename BAM_reads_filtering.Rmd to genetic_load_variants_final_pipeline.Rmd

Renamed BAM_reads_filtering.Rmd to genetic_load_variants_final_pipeline.Rmd.
Added $CALLING folders to depth calculus analysis to arrange everything better.
Added a $CALLING folder for each calling, and fixed all paths accordingly.
Minor changes.

Greatly modified the script to obtain per dataset VCFs for each calling, and to perform depth filtering for the joined lists of each dataset's outliers. Adapted per population and per individual split accordingly. Added new SYN and NSYN variant count figures.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/Arynio/genome-annotation
Modified depth calculus code so that it runs in parallel for all datasets (5x, GP, MG...) within each calling.
transform ibd file to bed
Minor changes.
Added joint calling for both species with same and orig cov.
Added universal code to sections: aafilled, polarized, annotated.
Rewrote code for annotation statistics so that it is universal for any VCF (by changing only the CALLING variable). Added code to plot results.
Restructured and rewrote the KO section. Plus minor changes.
Restructured Maria's code and wrote a loop for automatization at the population and feature level.
Rewrote code for perpop and per individual splits so that it is universal for any VCF (by changing only the CALLING variable).
Corrected filenames and paths.
Added a Lynx lynx calling that includes the pv sample for Maria's project.
Initial commit: copy of Maria's script.
Added Lynx pardinus - Lynx rufus comparison.
Added code to process all original- and same-coverage VCFs: polarization, annotation, depth calculus, and VCF filtering.
Fixed the binning code from the AFS figures.
Added separate calling for subsampled BAMs (~6x) and original BAMs (~65-25x) for both lp and ll.

Added NM proportion figure.
Added NM differential filterings for ll and lp. Included 25x samples.
Added figures for features ratios with different NM filters.
Added joint lp and ll variant calling.
Added code to convert from BAM to FASTA. Generated BAMs with NM≥5.
Minor changes.
Added dataset categories. Generated alternative PCA for the VCF from unfiltered BAMs.
Fixed size of the considered fraction of the genome.
Added w-g calling for both species (from NM≤4 BAMs).
Initial commit. Obtained PCA from VCF using SNPRelate.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/Arynio/genome-annotation
Added Lynx lynx w-g BAM filtering with NM≤4.
coverage calculation
finish script
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/Arynio/genome-annotation
Added UCNE to per individual variant counts.
Added MQ comparison. Added post-calling steps: renaming, AA-filling, polarisation, annotation, filtering, per population split, per individual split, individual variant counts.
adding depth calculation script + SAF calculation
starting the script ANGSD: depth
Changed order of the sections, and added variant calling.
Tested 0.2 missingness filter and subsequent steps.

Initial commit: obtained gene-only bed file to subset BAMs, added code to subset BAMs, added code to filter high NM (edit distance) reads from BAMs, and obtained per-sample distribution of edit distance.
Minor changes.
Obtained lists of general and private snps and syn snps for each dataset, and drew their AF.
Created this script with a section where comparison bed files are made from vcf files (or from my custom substitution file), and a second section where venn diagrams are drawn.
Copied the separate calling script and modified it in order to make a two-individual calling with both the original and the recalibrated BAMs, via both gVCF and direct VCF.
Added lp GP only calling all the way to the per individual calling.
Added code to obtain ll-lp substitutions.

Performed 4 different callings for lp_sm_0134 and lp_smo_0138:
· 1) with the recalibrated BAMs with gVCFs (the one we used up until now).
· 2) with the recalibrated BAMs without gVCFs (direct calling).
· 3) with the original BAMs without gVCFs (direct calling).
· 4) with the original BAMs with gVCFs (these gVCFs were also called here).
Added individual annotation statistics for the 5x lp subset. Other minor changes.
Obtained SAM files from 3 BAM files from different datasets.
Added lp 5x VCF analysis all the way until the per individual split. Added subdivisions to certain sections.
Added masking of AF=1. Added per individual annotation statistics with and without AF=1.
Corrected filtering step 4, added new DP calculus for ll populations, added filtering step 5 and obtained per pop and per individual VCFs.
Minor changes.
Added code to rename samples with bad names. Added Lynx lynx and lynx pardinus subsections to the aa-filling and the polarize sections.
Added servers speed tests and minor changes.
Added per species separate calling of all sites, as substitutions between species will be lost otherwise.
Added callable universe calling with repetitive regions (faster). Added individual annotation statistics for the dataset with the other species' substitutions.
Initial commit. Copied the genetic_load_annotation_contemporary script. Added separate calling for each species.

Added matrix with variants and substitutions among the two species. Added per species AFS for all variants and for the other species' substitutions. Individual VCFs for the other species' substitutions.
Added section with genome project variants. Added AFS for each species, for one vs. the other, and for their substitutions.
Added strict missingness filter and subsequent sections for this version of the files.
Added other levels of NS & S comparisons with the genome project dataset. Minor changes.

Added:
· Rufus based annotation.
· Filtering of AA ≠ (REF | ALT) in common VCF
· Filtering of AF = 0 & AF = 1 in common VCF
· Minor changes to paths and filenames
· Perfected figures with allele ratios
· Compared NS/S mutations with genome project
Obtained allele frequency spectra after excluding fixed derived alleles. Prettified AFS graphs. Obtained NS/S ratio for the whole lp.
Added code to plot the ratios of the counts.
Added code to remove AA=N positions. Added optional code to remove AF=1 positions. Obtained allel counts files for all those subsets.
Fixed bugs in the section that tests allele counts for the original VCFs.
Added code to test allele counts from the original per species VCFs (without the subsequent filtering).
Fixed code in the SM mixed subsetting. Added minimum subsetting for lp. Added comparison of population statistics between species (with minimum subsetting).
Added code to identify and plot highest-kinship individuals. Added "coding" category to variant count files. Restructured some sections.
Added allele counts to the per population and per individual variant counts files.
Adapted code to count variants per population and per individual.
Added relatedness- and random-based subsampling of populations. Also per-individual VCFs. And minor changes.
Added ANGSD and NGSrelate code to obtain kinships.
Added plink kinship calculus and igraph network analysis to remove individuals based on kinship.
Started with different strategies to subsample populations: all combinations (discarded) and lowest relatedness (work in progress).
Adapted code to split per-species VCFs into per-population VCFs.
Ploted distribution of Het ratio in R.
Added bcftools code to filter each species based on missingness and depth. Created bed file for each species with per-variant HET ratio. Added code to filter each species based on HET ratio.
Minor changes.
Properly structured the filter sections before and after splitting the VCF into species. Added María's depth calculus.
Changed VCF file to be used here to the more general c_ll_lp_plus_h_ll. Ran polarization and annotation. Changed custom annotation file with UCNE version. Moved filters section after annotation.
Added the final version of the VCF polarizing code by José Luis Castro.
Added warning notes about subsetting VCFs with BCFtools.
Added ThreePop analyses for Yakutia as the admixed.
Added remarks for the future.
Fixed paths and other minor changes.
Minor changes.
Replaced test gl file with the actual data in the ngsF-HMM section.
Cleaned the script and ran the genotype likelihoods for my data.
adding depth calculus
Changed intergenic.bamlist to bamlist.
Added additional m=2 runs, their plots and ggtree tests.
Added Maria's code to generate BEAGLE format genotype likelihoods file.
Added coordinates list for variable positions.
Added code to obtain fraction of variance for TreeMix, and recoded name and path of some m=0 runs.
Added code to generate genome coordinates file. Added code to test ngsF-HMM.
Added missing line to return genotypes. Also junk code trying to recode the AF field.
Initial commit.
Toy output of VcfFilterJdk.
Toy file for testing VcfFilterJdk.
Added VcfFilterJdk code to polarize the annotated VCF, although it crashes due to a bug.
Added Federico Abascal's code to polarize VCF, but it doesn't work...
Added code to reannotate the already annotated population VCFs in order to obtain the stats files.
Fixed file names.
Added code to split annotated VCF into per population VCF, and then to keep only variable positions, or those fixed for the derived allele.

Rearranged order of VCF processing. Now it goes: polarization -> variant quality trimming -> variant annotation -> per population trimming -> per individual trimming. Added respective code and minor changes.
Added code to obtain new VCF with Lynx rufus as the reference.
Update and rename c_lp_ll_lc_lr_VCF.Rmd to substitutions_lynx_genus_VCFs.Rmd
Rename SnpEff_script.Rmd to genetic_load_annotation_contemporary.Rmd
Update and rename filtered_BAMs_analysis.Rmd to contamination_filtered_VCFs.Rmd
Update and rename TreeMix_script.Rmd to ll_phylogeography_TreeMix.Rmd
Update and rename c_lp_ll_VCF.Rmd to ll_phylogeography_VCFs.Rmd

Added SnpEff summary stats (population and individual level).

Restructured script. Added polarization code.
Added code to annotate individual VCFs.
Added code to trim population VCFs (keep only true variants within populations). Added code to obtain individual VCFs.
Corrected code to trim population VCFs with BCFtools.
Changed detailed annotation to basic + manual annotation with the -interval command.
Added code for detailed annotation (including new LYPA genome database).
Minor changes.
Restructured the script, added c_ll and c_lp annotation.
Removed unused line.
Changed some comments to include better descriptions.
Fixed code to classify and to filter positions.
Added standard error calculations to TreeMix code.
Finished code to classify positions and extract callable universe.
Fixed paths in intergenic input section. Added TreeMix runs and graphs for intergenic. Added ThreePop for intergenic.
Added section for joint ll and lr VCF, and for SNPs extraction. Added code to classify positions.
Renamed samples in VCFs and corrected filenames accordingly.
Corrected section title.
Added intergenic subsampling.
Renamed samples with badly formatted names.
Filtered Rufus SNPs, added TreeMix with Mongolia, started intergenic filtering.
Adapted code and names, removed unnecessary sections.
Revised allele counts code to include substitutions from lr. New lr gVCF and VCF from high coverage BAM.
Included gVCFs for 25x Macrogen samples and VCF with and without unvariable sites.
Initial commit: copied the c_lp_ll_VCF script in its entirety.
